BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: INTL UNION OF PAINTERS & ALLIED TRADES

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ORGANIZE WORKERS AND TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES AND LIVELIHOODS AND THE WELFARE OF THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH THE BENEFITS OF COLLECTIVE BARGAINING, AND PROMOTE HARMONY AND UNITY BETWEEN LOCAL UNIONS IN THE DISTRICT.

OtherExpensesGrp.Desc: Expenses on Behalf of Rel. Org

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Income Tax Status:The International Union of Painters and Allied Trades District Council No. 5 is exempt from federal income taxes under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(5) and, therefore, has made no provision for federal income taxes in the accompanying financial statements. During the years ended June 30, 2023 and 2022, the Council recorded no unrelated business income and recognized no income tax related interest or penalties.The Council accounts for tax positions in accordance with FASB Accounting Standards Codification Topic 740, Income Taxes. With few exceptions, the Council is subject to federal and state income tax examinations by tax authorities for the prior three years. Management has reviewed the Council's tax positions and determined there were no uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2023 and 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Funds donated for charitable, political, or scholarship purposes are approved by the Executive Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Third-party administrator collects dues check-off for the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S MEMBERS ARE EMPLOYEES OF EMPLOYERS THAT ARE SIGNATORY TO VARIOUS COLLECTIVE BARGAINING AGREEMENTS WITH THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GENERAL MEMBERSHIP OF THE COUNCIL ELECTS DELEGATES AND THE BUSINESS MANAGER/SECRETARY-TREASURER. THE DELEGATES THEN ELECT THE OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, AND EXECUTIVE BOARD OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PER THE ORGANIZATION'S BY-LAWS AND GENERAL CONSTITUTION, THE GOVERNING BODY IS AUTHORIZED TO MAKE ANY FINANCIAL DECISIONS, WHICH ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE ELECTED DELEGATE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE OFFICE MANAGER AND THEN PRESENTED TO THE GOVERNING BODY (BUSINESS MANAGER/SECRETARY-TREASURER) FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT THROUGH STAFF REPORTS/REVIEW AND TRIAL BOARDS, AS OUTLINED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS AND CONSTITUTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION PROCESS OUTLINED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS AND CONSTITUTION IS BY ELECTIONS AND APPOINTMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICES FOR REVIEW BY MEMBERS UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
